bonzai.api

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • bonzai.api.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blocker, Cleaner, Hat, Scout, Wizard

    public class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    An Actor describes the properties of a character in the game and gives you functions to control them if you are able. Each Actor has a "TYPE" given to them. These types are represented by final static integers. For example, if myActor.getType() == Actor.WIZARD, 'myActor' can safely be typecast to a Wizard. ((Wizard)myActor)

      • Actor

        public Actor(bonzai.game.actor.TrueActor a,
     int viewingTeam)
        Creates an Actor.
        Parameters:
        a - : the parent Actor
        viewingTeam - : the team this Actor is on

    • Method Detail

      • isWild

        public boolean isWild()

        Determine if this unit is under the effects of wild magic.

        Wild Magic occurs when two Wizards cast a spell on the same Actor during the same turn. When an Actor is under the influence of wild magic, that Actor moves randomly for a few turns.

        Returns:
        True if the actor is under the effects of wild magic.

      • getID

        public int getID()

        Gets the ID of the Actor. Each Actor has a unique ID.

        Returns:
        A unique Actor ID. Returns -1 if you do not control the actor.

      • isNeutral

        public boolean isNeutral()

        Determine whether this enemy is neutral.

        Returns:
        True if the unit is neutral and on a visible space. Returns false otherwise.

      • getTeam

        public int getTeam()

        Gets the team number that this actor is controlled by.

        The player team numbers starts at 1.

        A neutral unit will return a value of 0.

        Returns:
        The team number of the given Actor. Also, returns -1 if the Actor cannot be seen.

      • getType

        public int getType()

        Gets the unit type of actor.

        For Example, AIGameState.getMyWizard().getType() == WIZARD would return true.

        Returns:
        The unit type of the actor as an integer.

      • getLocation

        public Node getLocation()
        Gets the Node that the Actor is currently on.
        Returns:
        The location of the Actor or 'null' if the Actor is not visible.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Determine if this actor is visible to your player.
        Returns:
        true if the node this actor resides on is visible to your player. Returns false otherwise.

      • move

        public boolean move(int dir)

        Request to move your actor in the given direction.

        When executed, the actor moves in the given direction.

        Specify directions using the following:
        • Node.UP
        • Node.DOWN
        • Node.LEFT
        • Node.RIGHT
        Parameters:
        dir - : the direction to move
        Returns:
        True if you are not moving into a wall. (Note: also returns true if you are trying to move into a blocking blocker.)
        See Also:
        APITools.getPath(Node start, Node dest, WeightComparator comp)

      • move

        public boolean move(java.util.ArrayList<Node> path)

        Request to move your actor along a path.

        When executed, the actor moves the next step along the path.

        Specify directions using the following:
        Parameters:
        path - : the path to follow
        Returns:
        True if you are not moving into a wall. (Note: also returns true if you are trying to move into a blocking blocker.)
        See Also:
        APITools.getPath(Node start, Node dest, WeightComparator comp)

      • useAbility

        protected boolean useAbility(Actor target)

        Request to use an ability.

        Some actors have type specific abilities. If the Actor has an ability, this function requests that Actors correct ability.

        Actors that do not have abilities: Hats and Scouts.

        Parameters:
        target - : the target actor
        Returns:
        True if you can use this Ability
        See Also:
        Wizard.castMagic(Actor), Blocker.block(), Blocker.unBlock(), Cleaner.sweep(Actor)

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int dir)

        Checks to see if this actor can move in a certain direction. The actor can always move unless it is stunned or the given direction is a wall or a blocking blocker.

        Parameters:
        dir - : the direction to move (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT)
        Returns:
        True if the actor can move in that direction. False if the node is not visible or if the Node in the direction is a wall (which includes Nodes that contain a blocking blocker).

      • isAdjacent

        public boolean isAdjacent(Actor target)

        Checks to see if the target actor is adjacent to this actor.

        Parameters:
        target - : the target actor
        Returns:
        True if the target actor is one square to the left, right, in front of, behind, or on top of this actor.

      • canAct

        public boolean canAct()

        Checks to see if the actor can use their ability. Actors can't use their ability while stunned, and some Actors have a cooldown which is a set amount of turns that the Actor must wait before using an ability again.

        Returns:
        True if the actor is can use their ability. False if the actor is on "cooldown", if the actor is stunned, or if the actor is not visible.

      • isStunned

        public boolean isStunned()
        Checks to see if this Actor is stunned.
        Returns:
        True if the actor is stunned. False if the actor is not stunned or if the actor is not visible.

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(Node start,
               Node dest,
               WeightComparator comp)
        Get the next direction in a path from the start node to the destination node.
        Parameters:
        start - : the start node
        dest - : the destination node
        comp - : a WeightComparator to evaluate each tile
        Returns:
        An integer direction (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT). Also returns -1 if the actor cannot get to the destination node or if the actor is not visible.

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection(Node dest,
               WeightComparator comp)
        Determine the next direction to move (calls getPath()- consider caching instead).
        Parameters:
        dest - : the destination node
        comp - : a WeightComparator to evaluate each tile
        Returns:
        The direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT). Also returns -1 if the actor cannot get to the destination node or if the actor is not visible.

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(java.util.ArrayList<Node> path,
               int step)
        Get the next direction in a path.
        Parameters:
        path - : a pre-built path
        step - : number of steps already taken
        Returns:
        The direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT). Also returns -1 if the actor cannot get to the destination node or if the actor is not visible.

      • getDirection

        public final int getDirection(java.util.ArrayList<Node> path)
        Get the next direction for an actor along a path
        Parameters:
        path - : a pre-built path
        Returns:
        The direction of the next step in the path (Node.UP, Node.DOWN, Node.LEFT, Node.RIGHT). Also returns -1 if the actor cannot get to the destination node or if the actor is not visible.

      • shout

        public final void shout(java.lang.String text)
        Tells an actor to shout, drawing text above them. If an actor is told multiple times to shout, the last shout specified is the one displayed. Use this for debugging, chanting, or taunting your opponent. Inappropriate language will result in disqualification.
        Parameters:
        text - : The text to be drawn on-screen.
